items.name: Banana
items.comment: Babanas are not only a yummy fruit, it's also packed with important nutrients such as vitamin A, B and C, magnesium, potassium, iron and fibre. In addition to that, they are naturally free of salt, cholesterol and fat. That's why you should enjoy bananas!

items.name: Crisps
items.comment: This may not come as a surprise, but crisps aren't healthy! The carbohydrates in crisps are so-called empty, which means they have very low nutritional value, and therefore easily contribute to overweight and obesity.

items.name: Pizza
items.comment: Pizza isn't the healthiest food you can eat, but in term of content it isn't really bad food... It contains carbohydrates, protein, vitamins and minerals if you have it as topping. Unfortunately, most of the content consists of fat, which is because the cheese on the pizza is so greasy.

items.name: Carrot
items.comment: Carrots is to be enjoyed, one single carrot covers the entire daily requirement of vitamin A!

items.name: Broccoli
items.comment: Broccoli should be in your diet, it contains vitamin C and K, antioxidants, folic acid, calcium... well, the list can be made almost endless of all the benefits it contains!

items.name: Ice Cream
items.comment: ...for real, do I need to explain it?

items.name: Cheesecake
items.comment: ...for real, do I need to explain it?

items.name: Almond
items.comment: As long as you aren't allergic you should try out almonds! They are rich in fiber and a very good source of important minerals such as phosphorus, iron, calcium, magnesium, selenium and zinc.

items.name: Avocado
items.comment: Treat yourself to avocados! They contain vitamins A and E, avocatin B, alpha and beta carotene, biotin and vegetable and unsaturated fats.

items.name: Hamburger
items.comment: ...for real, do I need to explain it?

items.name: Cauliflower
items.comment: Cauliflowers aren't just a work of art, they contain vitamin C and potassium, also the substance allicin! Allicin can reduce inflammation and also controls the aging process in the body. Enjoy it instead!

items.name: Corn
items.comment: You should enjoy corn! It provides over 10% of your recommended daily intake of phosphorus, magnesium, potassium, vitamin C and the B vitamibns folate, thiamin and B12. It is also a good source of provitamin A, vitamin E, iron, manganese, selenium, sodium and zinc.

items.name: Walnuts
items.comment: You should enjoy walnuts! Just 100 grams contain 7,5 grams of omega 3. You also get a lot of vitamin B6, which is good for your metabolism and the formation of red blood cells.

items.name: Fried chicken
items.comment: ...for real, do I need to explain it?

items.name: Fries
items.comment: ...for real, do I need to explain it?

items.name: Ketchup
items.comment: This might come as a surprise, but ketchup contains A LOT of sugars!

items.name: Lemon
items.comment: You should enjoy lemons in your food, tea or maybe even spice up your water with one! It contains citric acid, magnesium, bioflavonoids, vitamin C, pectin, calcium, potassium and limonene, which help the immunte system fight infections.

items.name: Lentils
items.comment: You should enjoy lentils! They contain good protein, are low in fat, complex carbohydrates and they are rich in fiber. They also contain vitamins such as folic acid, riboflavin, thiamin and niacin.

items.name: Mashed potatoes
items.comment: If you mash your taters, 25% more sugars are released than if you just cut it.

items.name: Salmon
items.comment: You should enjoy salmon! It has high content of, among other things, selenium, B6, niacin, B12, phosphorus.

items.name: Sweet potatoes
items.comment: You should enjoy sweet potatoes! They contain 10 times more calcium than regular potatoes! Also rich in vitamin C, A and B6, as well as magnesium.

items.name: Toilet paper
items.comment: ...why would you want to eat this?! D:

items.name: Watermelon
items.comment: You should enjoy watermelons! It contains among other things, vitamin C, which is an important antioxidant, and vitamin B6, which contributes to your metabolism.

items.name: Water
items.comment: You should really drink water... An adult consists of approximately 60% water! Namely water is a good solvent, whuch can be used by the body to transport salts, carohydrates and proteins to the right place.

items.name: Alcohol
items.comment: This should be avoided! The body burns the alcohol first. For example, none of what you ate is burned until all the alcohol is burned. Since alcohol is toxic to the body, the liver works to get rid of it first of all. This in turn means that fat burning is reduced and the fat is stored.

items.name: Cupcake
items.comment: ...for real, do I need to explain it?

items.name: Croissant
items.comment: Butterrrrrrrrrr bomb

items.name: Coctail
items.comment: This should be avoided! The body burns the alcohol first. For example, none of what you ate is burned until all the alcohol is burned. Since alcohol is toxic to the body, the liver works to get rid of it first of all. This in turn means that fat burning is reduced and the fat is stored.

items.name: Apple
items.comment: You should enjoy apples! They lower blood fats and blood pressure, and stabilize blood sugar. All of which reduce the risk of a number of serious diseases.

items.name: Blueberries
items.comment: You should enjoy blueberries! They are characterized by their high nutrition, fiber, vitamins and minerals, as wel as their high levels of many different bioactive substances. These bioactive substances protect against cardiovascular diseases.

items.name: Egg
items.comment: You should enjoy eggs! Contains high-quality protein! The egg white contains proteins and the yolk contains fats, cholesterol and carotenoids.

items.name: White bread
items.comment: Sugarbomb!

items.name: Soda
items.comment: ...for real, do I need to explain it?

items.name: Chicken
items.comment: You should enjoy chicken! Rich in proteins and vitamins.

items.name: Cookie
items.comment: ...for real, do I need to explain it?

items.name: Ginger
items.comment: You should enjoy ginger! This root contains a large amount of good vitamins, such as vitamin A, B, C and E.

items.name: Grape
items.comment: You should enjoy grapes, and maybe even their seeds! They are rich in menerals such as iron and potassium and contain a lot of vitamin K and B1. Surprisingly, the grape seeds are just as healthy as the whole grape!

items.name: Lettuce
items.comment: You should enjoy lettuce! Choose varieties such as arugula, endive, mache and baby spinach instead of iceberg lettuce and green salad. These varieties are loaded with important vitamins and minerals such as vitamin C, iron, zinc, magnesium, selenium, potassium and calcium.

items.name: Flavored milk
items.comment: Flavored milk should be avoided! Regular milk can be healthy, but these flavoured kinds are just packed with sugars.

items.name: Nuts
items.comment: As long as you aren't allergic, you should enjoy nuts! They are very rich in fats, both polyunsaturated and monounsaturated. They contain a lot of vitamin E which acts as an antiocidant. They also contain some proteins and minerals such as magnesium, iron, zinc and phosphorus.

items.name: Orange
items.comment: You should enjoy oranges! They consist of vitamin C, flavonoids and beta-carotene, which together act as a powerful antiocidant that helps to cleanse the body and prevent cardiovascular diseases, degenerative diseases, cancer, etc.

items.name: Pie
items.comment: ...for real, do I need to explain it?

items.name: Rye bread
items.comment: You should enjoy rye bread! Provides a more even blood sugar level, longer satiety, creates weight control, counteracts type 2 diabetes and is positive for the intestinal flora.

items.name: Tea
items.comment: You should enjoy tea! Among other things, it is good for the heart and blood vessels and also contributes to improving concentration and learning ability. Green tea is packed with antiocidants and is said to be good agains cardiovascular disease, stress, gout, cancer and a number of other diseases and ailments.
